content.description: Start low at a right hand crimp and a left rail. Follow rails up to the top - finish with two hands on final jug (the topout is sketchy).
content.location: Park near Milton Boulders, follow tree trail across the lot to the Smitten Boulders, there are further problems right above other giant boulder in the cave.

content.description:
I am not 100% sure this is an FA, but there wasn't a sign of chalk on the second half of the problem and no documentation anywhere online. It seems unlikely this hasn't been done before. Either way, here it is:

From the ground, it seems like it'd be an eliminate, but it actually climbs quite well and forces movement through the most interesting holds:

Start as for

The Hungover Cure

. Once on the flat ledge about halfway up, bust hard right to the blunt arete, bump into some bad holds on the face, and then float up to the sharp pancake-like crimp jug. Finish right around the boulder. A video is available here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cCnjlfiTGS0&feature=youtu.be

.
content.location:
This is directly across the road from the Milton Boulder. It is on the far right side of the boulder. Start as for

The Hungover Cure

, V6-. It has a 30 foot approach from the parking.
